sections.heading: The Illinois Muslim American Advisory Council
sections.text: There is hereby created the Illinois Muslim American Advisory Council. The purpose of the Council is to advise the Governor and the General Assembly on policy issues impacting Muslim Americans and immigrants; to advance the role and civic participation

sections.heading: Meetings. The Council shall meet at least once per month
sections.text: In addition, the Council may hold up to 2 public hearings annually to assist in the development of policy recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly. All meetings of the Council shall be conducted in accordance with the Open Mee

sections.heading: Reports. The Council shall issue semi-annual reports on its policy recommendations by June 30th and December 31st of each year to the Governor, the General Assembly, and the Commission on Equity and Inclusion
sections.text: Reports. The Council shall issue semi-annual reports on its policy recommendations by June 30th and December 31st of each year to the Governor, the General Assembly, and the Commission on Equity and Inclusion.

sections.heading: Oversight. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, the Commission on Equity and Inclusion established under the Commission on Equity and Inclusion Act shall have general oversight of the operations of the Council
sections.text: Oversight. Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, the Commission on Equity and Inclusion established under the Commission on Equity and Inclusion Act shall have general oversight of the operations of the Council.

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
